enum16.name: Object Type
enum16.tooltip: changing this would not be wise

bit.name: Search Cardinal Direction Lightmaps on Failure
Extension Of Parent
bit.tooltip: object uses parent's markers

bit.name: Sample Environment Lighting Only Ignore Object Lighting
Effects Created By This Object Do Not Spawn Objects In Multiplayer
Does Not Collide With Camera
bit.tooltip: force camera not to collide with object. By default small sweetener objects do not collide

bit.name: Force Collide With Camera
bit.tooltip: force the camera to collide with this object, By default small sweetener objects do not collide

bit.name: Damage Not Blocked By Obstructions
bit.tooltip: AOE damage being applied to this object does not test for obstrutions.

float32.name: Bounding Radius
float32.tooltip: If you edit this field manually, beware that the render model is no longer respected for radius calculation and that you need to set the bounding offset as well.

float32.name: Dynamic Light Sphere Radius
float32.tooltip: sphere to use for dynamic lights and shadows. only used if not 0

tagRef.name: Collision Damage
tagRef.tooltip: only set this tag if you want to override the default collision damage values in globals.globals

stringid.name: Node Name
stringid.tooltip: empty means object space

tagRef.name: Melee Sound
tagRef.tooltip: this is the sound that is made when I am meleed. This overrides the sweetener sound of my material.

stringid.name: AI Type Name
stringid.tooltip: used for combat dialogue, etc.

stringid.name: Interaction Name
stringid.tooltip: if you checked the consider for interaction flag, type what interaction the AI should do with this object

bit.name: Invert
bit.tooltip: result of function is one minus actual result

bit.name: Mapping Does Not Controls Active
bit.tooltip: the curve mapping can make the function active/inactive

bit.name: Always Active
bit.tooltip: function does not deactivate when at or below lower bound

bit.name: Random Time Offset
bit.tooltip: function offsets periodic function input by random value between 0 and 1

bit.name: Always Exports Value
bit.tooltip: when this function is deactivated, it still exports its value

bit.name: Turn Off With Uses Magnitude
bit.tooltip: the function will be turned off if the value of the turns_off_with function is 0

stringid.name: Import Name
stringid.tooltip: if you leave this field blank then you can set this function's input value with the hs_function object_set_function_variable

stringid.name: Turn Off With
stringid.tooltip: if the specified function is off, so is this function

stringid.name: Ranged Interpolation Name
stringid.tooltip: if you have the ranged button checked

float32.name: Minimum Value
float32.tooltip: function must exceed this value (after mapping) to be active 0. means do nothing

tagblock.name: Interpolation

option.name: Fractional
option.tooltip: covers a fixed fraction of the distance to the target on each update

float32.name: Linear Travel Time
float32.tooltip: used by constant velocity

float32.name: Acceleration
float32.tooltip: used by linear acceleration

tagblock.comment: the damping ratio is c/(2*sqrt(k)). if this ratio is: = 0 : oscillates forever < 1 : oscillates with decreasing amplitude = 1 : reaches the target precisely and quickly (no oscillation) > 1 : reaches the target slowly the higher the value of k, the quicker the system will reach the target value

float32.name: Spring k
float32.tooltip: used by damped spring, determines acceleration by displacement

float32.name: Spring c
float32.tooltip: used by damped spring, determines damping based on velocity

float32.name: Fraction
float32.tooltip: used by fractional, how mush of the distance to the target to cover each update

int32.name: Runtime Interpolator To Object Function Mapping

bit.name: Force Always On
bit.tooltip: when this flag is clear we only create the attachment when the function object function is active or set to empty string

bit.name: Effect Size Scale From Object Scale
Works On Land
bit.tooltip: drives on an extruded version of everything physical in your level

stringId.name: Variant Name
stringId.tooltip: if empty, may be used by any model variant

bit.name: Blend In HSV
bit.tooltip: blends colors in hsv rather than rgb space

bit.name: ...More Colors
bit.tooltip: blends colors through more hues (goes the long way around the color wheel)

tagblock.name: Multiplayer Object

flags8.name: Game Engine Flags
flags8.tooltip: Set which game engines you desire this object to appear in

tagblock.comment: Type pertains to how you want the game engine to handle this object Certain flags applicable only to certain object types, should be self evident
These are respawn zone weights, used only for respawn zones
These fields are only used for defining certain, special markers to use for positional locations if the default position (object origin) is not sufficient

tagref.name: Spawned Object
tagref.tooltip: If this object is intended to spawn something, the object it spawns should be specified here

tagref.name: Simulation Interpolation
tagref.tooltip: Set to a specific interpolation definition, or leave blank to inherit the default for the object type (there are defaults for bipeds, vehicles, and crates in multiplayer_globals).

tagblock.name: Spawn Effects
tagblock.comment: Effect played when an object of this type spawns in during each game mode. Unlike creation effect, it is only played when the object spawns in through certain methods, not whenever one is created.

tagRef.name: Multiplayer Spawn Effect
tagRef.tooltip: effect played when this object spawns in MP games

tagRef.name: Survival Spawn Effect
tagRef.tooltip: effect played when this object spawns in Firefight games

tagRef.name: Campaign Spawn Effect
tagRef.tooltip: effect played when this object spawns in Campaign games

bit.name: Flashlight Power Doesn't Transfer To Weapon

option.name: Silent
option.tooltip: ai will not respond to this sound

option.name: Loud
option.tooltip: ai can hear this sound at any range

bit.name: Hides Player-Unit From Camera
bit.tooltip: the player controlling this camera will not see their unit. All other cameras will see this unit

bit.name: Use Aiming Vector Instead Of Marker Forward
bit.tooltip: for cameras without tracks that use a marker position, specifies that we use the unit's aiming vector instead of the marker's forward vector. This results in more accurate aiming and smoother movement when frames are dropped

degree.name: Look Acceleration
degree.tooltip: if non-zero, limits the change in look velocity per second while the user is pushing the look stick in the current direction of looking

degree.name: Look Deceleration
degree.tooltip: if non-zero, limits the change in look velocity per second while the user is not pushing the look stick or changing directions

float32.name: Look Acceleration Smoothing Fraction
float32.tooltip: if non-zero, when the desired velocity change is less than this fraction of the acceleration, starts interpolating the maximum acceleration towards zero. You can think of this as a time in seconds where if the velocity would reach its target in this amount of time or less, it will start taking longer.

degree.name: Override Field Of View
degree.tooltip: if non-zero, overrides the FOV set in the unit or globals

float32.name: Cylinder Fraction
float32.tooltip: controls how far from the focus point the outer raycasts start. 0 == cone, 1 == cylinder

degree.name: Obstruction Test Angle
degree.tooltip: how wide of a cone to test

float32.name: Obstruction Maximum Inward Acceleration
float32.tooltip: how quickly the camera moves inward when it anticipates a collision

float32.name: Obstruction Maximum Outward Acceleration
float32.tooltip: how quickly the camera returns to a normal position when its anticipated distance is further than its current

float32.name: Obstruction Maximum Velocity
float32.tooltip: maximum speed the camera can move

float32.name: Obstruction Return Delay
float32.tooltip: when the camera wants to start moving back out, wait this long before doing so

float32.name: Maximum Camera Velocity
float32.tooltip: how quickly the camera can move to a new displacement (if the velocity suddenly changes). During this time the aim vector for the unit will be inaccurate, so don't set this too low. 0 defaults to infinite.

float32.name: Maximum Value
float32.tooltip: for linear velocity; this is wu/s. for linear acceleration; this is the fraction of the seat acceleration. for angular velocity; this is deg/s

float32.name: Camera Scale (Axial)
float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is along the axis of the forward vector of the camera

float32.name: Camera Scale (Perpendicular)
float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is perpendicular to the camera

float32.name: Maximum Value
float32.tooltip: for linear velocity; this is wu/s. for linear acceleration; this is the fraction of the seat acceleration. for angular velocity; this is deg/s

float32.name: Camera Scale (Axial)
float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is along the axis of the forward vector of the camera

float32.name: Camera Scale (Perpendicular)
float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is perpendicular to the camera

float32.name: Maximum Value
float32.tooltip: for linear velocity; this is wu/s. for linear acceleration; this is the fraction of the seat acceleration. for angular velocity; this is deg/s

float32.name: Camera Scale (Axial)
float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is along the axis of the forward vector of the camera

float32.name: Camera Scale (Perpendicular)
float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is perpendicular to the camera

float32.name: Peg Threshold
float32.tooltip: [0,1] magnitude of analog input for pegged acceleration to kick in

point2.name: Pegged Time
point2.tooltip: time for a pegged look to reach maximum effect

point2.name: Pegged Scale
point2.tooltip: the maximum effect achieved over the duration of the pegged time.

degree.name: Peg Maximum Angular Velocity
degree.tooltip: the maximum turning speed during peg

float32.name: Peg Threshold
float32.tooltip: [0,1] magnitude of analog input for pegged acceleration to kick in

point2.name: Pegged Time
point2.tooltip: time for a pegged look to reach maximum effect

point2.name: Pegged Scale
point2.tooltip: the maximum effect achieved over the duration of the pegged time.

degree.name: Peg Maximum Angular Velocity
degree.tooltip: the maximum turning speed during peg

bit.name: Hides Player-Unit From Camera
bit.tooltip: the player controlling this camera will not see their unit. All other cameras will see this unit

bit.tooltip: for cameras without tracks that use a marker position, specifies that we use the unit's aiming vector instead of the marker's forward vector. This results in more accurate aiming and smoother movement when frames are dropped

degree.tooltip: if non-zero, limits the change in look velocity per second while the user is not pushing the look stick or changing directions

You can think of this as a time in seconds where if the velocity would reach its target in this amount of time or less, it will start taking longer.

degree.tooltip: if non-zero, overrides the FOV set in the unit or globals

float32.tooltip: controls how far from the focus point the outer raycasts start. 0 == cone, 1 == cylinder

degree.tooltip: how wide of a cone to test

float32.tooltip: how quickly the camera moves inward when it anticipates a collision

float32.tooltip: how quickly the camera returns to a normal position when its anticipated distance is further than its current

float32.tooltip: when the camera wants to start moving back out, wait this long before doing so

float32.tooltip: for linear velocity; this is wu/s. for linear acceleration; this is the fraction of the seat acceleration. for angular velocity; this is deg/s

float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is along the axis of the forward vector of the camera

float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is perpendicular to the camera

float32.tooltip: for linear velocity; this is wu/s. for linear acceleration; this is the fraction of the seat acceleration. for angular velocity; this is deg/s

float32.name: Camera Scale (Axial)
float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is along the axis of the forward vector of the camera

float32.name: Camera Scale (Perpendicular)
float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is perpendicular to the camera

float32.name: Maximum Value
float32.tooltip: for linear velocity; this is wu/s. for linear acceleration; this is the fraction of the seat acceleration. for angular velocity; this is deg/s

point2.tooltip: time for a pegged look to reach maximum effect

point2.tooltip: the maximum effect achieved over the duration of the pegged time.

degree.name: Peg Maximum Angular Velocity
degree.tooltip: the maximum turning speed during peg

float32.name: Peg Threshold
float32.tooltip: [0,1] magnitude of analog input for pegged acceleration to kick in

point2.name: Pegged Time
point2.tooltip: time for a pegged look to reach maximum effect

point2.name: Pegged Scale
point2.tooltip: the maximum effect achieved over the duration of the pegged time.

degree.name: Peg Maximum Angular Velocity
degree.tooltip: the maximum turning speed during peg

stringid.name: Assassination Weapon Stow Marker
stringid.tooltip: the anchor we attach the knife to when we stow it

stringid.name: Assassination Weapon Out Marker
stringid.tooltip: the anchor we attach the knife to when we pull it out

stringid.name: Assassination Weapon Anchor Marker
stringid.tooltip: the marker on the knife that we anchor to the biped

float32.name: Soft Death Direction Speed Threshold
float32.tooltip: moving faster than this means you will soft death in the movement direction. zero defaults to damage direction.

float32.name: Pain Screen Duration
float32.tooltip: The duration of the pain function, 0 defaults to 0.5

float32.name: Pain Screen Region Fade Out Duration
float32.tooltip: The time it takes to fade out a damage region that is no longer the most recent damage region to be hit

float32.name: Pain Screen Region Fade Out Weight Threshold
float32.tooltip: The threshold weight below which the focus channel must fall before we can cross fade to another region.

degree.name: Pain Screen Angle Tolerance
degree.tooltip: The tolerance angle between next and previous damage directions, below which we randomly vary the ping direction.

degree.name: Pain Screen Angle Randomness
degree.tooltip: The maximum random angle to vary the incoming ping direction by if it's too close to the previous ping.

float32.name: Defensive Screen Duration
float32.tooltip: The duration of the defensive function, 0 defaults to 2.0

float32.name: Defensive Screen Scrub Fallback Fraction
float32.tooltip: When receiving multiple pings, this is the min percentage of the defensive screen scrub value will fallback to.

float32.name: Distance Of Dive Animation
float32.tooltip: this must be set to tell the AI how far it should expect our dive animation to move us

float32.name: Terminal Velocity Fall Ratio
float32.tooltip: ratio of airborne_arc animation to switch off falling overlay

float32.name: Stun Movement Penalty
float32.tooltip: 1.0 prevents moving while stunned

float32.name: Stun Turning Penalty
float32.tooltip: 1.0 prevents turning while stunned

float32.name: Stun Jumping Penalty
float32.tooltip: 1.0 prevents jumping while stunned

float32.name: Minimum Stun Time
float32.tooltip: all stunning damage will last for at least this long

float32.name: Maximum Stun Time
float32.tooltip: no stunning damage will last for longer than this

tagRef.name: Spawned Turret Character
tagRef.tooltip: automatically created character when this unit is driven

range16.name: Spawned Actor Count
range16.tooltip: number of actors which we spawn

float32.name: Spawned Velocity
float32.tooltip: velocity at which we throw spawned actors

stringid.name: Target Aiming Pivot Marker Name
stringid.tooltip: set this to have your weapon barrel point at its calcualed target instead of matching the aiming of the unit controlling it. This marker should be along the barrel at point that doesn't move when the barrel pitches up and down.

float32.name: Object Velocity Maximum
float32.tooltip: Debug value for object velocity that corresponds to a blend screen weight of 1, 0 defaults to 5.0

stringid.name: Right Hand Node
stringid.tooltip: where the primary weapon is attached

stringid.name: Left Hand Node
stringid.tooltip: where the seconday weapon is attached (for dual-pistol modes)

stringid.name: Preferred Gun Node
stringid.tooltip: if found, use this gun marker

stringid.name: Preferred Grenade Marker
stringid.tooltip: if found, use this marker to attach live grenades to

tagRef.name: Native Melee Override
tagRef.tooltip: when set, characters will melee with these settings rather than their actual held weapon. (for characters that melee with an off hand)

int16.name: Variant Number
int16.tooltip: variant number to use this dialogue with (must match the suffix in the permutations on the unit's model)

tagblock.name: Tracking Types
tagblock.tooltip: specify the kinds of targets this tracking system can lock on

tagblock.name: Seats

bit.name: Invisible
bit.tooltip: completely enclosed by vehicle

bit.name: Locked
bit.tooltip: when occupied, prevents enemies from entering locked seats

bit.name: First Person Camera Slaved To Gun
AI Firing Disabled By Maximum Acceleration
Takes Top Level Area of Effect Damage
Disallow Exit
bit.tooltip: Prevents the unit currently in the seat from exiting regardless of circumstances

float32.name: Turnover Time
float32.tooltip: how much time it takes to evict a rider from a flipped vehicle

float32.name: Listener Interpolation Factor
float32.tooltip: how far to interpolate listener position from camera to occupant's head

tagblock.comment: when the unit velocity is 0, the yaw/pitch rates are the left values at [max speed reference], the yaw/pitch rates are the right values. the max speed reference is what the code uses to generate a clamped speed from 0..1 the exponent controls how midrange speeds are interpreted. IOW: As velocity exceeds 'min speed' and approaches 'max speed', turn rates are scaled from low --> high

float32.name: Pitch Interpolation Time
float32.tooltip: 0 means use default 17

float32.name: Minimum Speed Reference
float32.tooltip: Initial t is computed from velocity/(max speed - min speed)

float32.name: Speed Exponent
float32.tooltip: if >0, t is then modified by raising to this exponent and result is used to linearly interpolate yaw/pitch rates

bit.name: Hides Player-Unit From Camera
bit.tooltip: the player controlling this camera will not see their unit. All other cameras will see this unit

bit.name: Use Aiming Vector Instead Of Marker Forward
bit.tooltip: for cameras without tracks that use a marker position, specifies that we use the unit's aiming vector instead of the marker's forward vector. This results in more accurate aiming and smoother movement when frames are dropped

degree.name: Look Acceleration
degree.tooltip: if non-zero, limits the change in look velocity per second while the user is pushing the look stick in the current direction of looking

degree.name: Look Deceleration
degree.tooltip: if non-zero, limits the change in look velocity per second while the user is not pushing the look stick or changing directions

float32.name: Look Acceleration Smoothing Fraction
float32.tooltip: if non-zero, when the desired velocity change is less than this fraction of the acceleration, starts interpolating the maximum acceleration towards zero. You can think of this as a time in seconds where if the velocity would reach its target in this amount of time or less, it will start taking longer.

degree.name: Override Field Of View
degree.tooltip: if non-zero, overrides the FOV set in the unit or globals

float32.name: Cylinder Fraction
float32.tooltip: controls how far from the focus point the outer raycasts start. 0 == cone, 1 == cylinder

degree.name: Obstruction Test Angle
degree.tooltip: how wide of a cone to test

float32.name: Obstruction Maximum Inward Acceleration
float32.tooltip: how quickly the camera moves inward when it anticipates a collision

float32.name: Obstruction Maximum Outward Acceleration
float32.tooltip: how quickly the camera returns to a normal position when its anticipated distance is further than its current

float32.name: Obstruction Maximum Velocity
float32.tooltip: maximum speed the camera can move

float32.name: Obstruction Return Delay
float32.tooltip: when the camera wants to start moving back out, wait this long before doing so

float32.name: Maximum Camera Velocity
float32.tooltip: how quickly the camera can move to a new displacement (if the velocity suddenly changes). During this time the aim vector for the unit will be inaccurate, so don't set this too low. 0 defaults to infinite.

float32.name: Maximum Value
float32.tooltip: for linear velocity; this is wu/s. for linear acceleration; this is the fraction of the seat acceleration. for angular velocity; this is deg/s

float32.name: Camera Scale (Axial)
float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is along the axis of the forward vector of the camera

float32.name: Camera Scale (Perpendicular)
float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is perpendicular to the camera

float32.name: Maximum Value
float32.tooltip: for linear velocity; this is wu/s. for linear acceleration; this is the fraction of the seat acceleration. for angular velocity; this is deg/s

float32.name: Camera Scale (Axial)
float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is along the axis of the forward vector of the camera

float32.name: Camera Scale (Perpendicular)
float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is perpendicular to the camera

float32.name: Maximum Value
float32.tooltip: for linear velocity; this is wu/s. for linear acceleration; this is the fraction of the seat acceleration. for angular velocity; this is deg/s

float32.name: Camera Scale (Axial)
float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is along the axis of the forward vector of the camera

float32.name: Camera Scale (Perpendicular)
float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is perpendicular to the camera

float32.name: Peg Threshold
float32.tooltip: [0,1] magnitude of analog input for pegged acceleration to kick in

point2.name: Pegged Time
point2.tooltip: time for a pegged look to reach maximum effect

point2.name: Pegged Scale
point2.tooltip: the maximum effect achieved over the duration of the pegged time.

degree.name: Peg Maximum Angular Velocity
degree.tooltip: the maximum turning speed during peg

float32.name: Peg Threshold
float32.tooltip: [0,1] magnitude of analog input for pegged acceleration to kick in

point2.name: Pegged Time
point2.tooltip: time for a pegged look to reach maximum effect

point2.name: Pegged Scale
point2.tooltip: the maximum effect achieved over the duration of the pegged time.

degree.name: Peg Maximum Angular Velocity
degree.tooltip: the maximum turning speed during peg

float32.name: Entry Radius
float32.tooltip: how close to the entry marker a unit must be

degree.name: Entry Marker Cone Angle
degree.tooltip: angle from marker forward the unit must be

degree.name: Entry Marker Facing Angle
degree.tooltip: angle from unit facing the marker must be

stringid.name: Open Function Name
stringid.tooltip: creates an object function with this name that you can use to query the open state of this seat

stringid.name: Opening Function Name
stringid.tooltip: goes from 0 to 1 over the course of opening and stays at 1 while open. Drops to 0 immediately when closing starts

stringid.name: Closing Function Name
stringid.tooltip: goes from 0 to 1 over the course of closing and stays at 1 while closed. Drops to 0 immediately when opening starts

float32.name: Opening Time
float32.tooltip: how long the unit takes to open when the hs_function unit_open is called. The current open state can be retrieved from the object function unit_open

float32.name: Closing Time
float32.tooltip: you don't have to go home, but you can't stay here

float32.name: Boost Rise Time
float32.tooltip: if the trigger is fully down, takes this long to reach peak power

float32.name: Boost Fall Time
float32.tooltip: if the trigger is let go (or peak time expires), takes this long to reach 0 power

float32.name: Boost Power Per Second
float32.tooltip: 1, means you burn all your power in one sec. .1 means you can boost for 10 seconds.

float32.name: Boost Recharge Rate
float32.tooltip: 1 means you recharge fully in 1 second. .1 means you rechage fully in 10 seconds

float32.name: Boost Recharge Delay
float32.tooltip: how long do you have to be off the tirgger for before boost starts recharging

float32.name: Minimum Speed Scale
float32.tooltip: as slow as we get

float32.name: Speed Scale
float32.tooltip: overall animation speed scale

float32.name: Elevation Change Rate
float32.tooltip: scale per update

float32.name: Proxy Body Offset
float32.tooltip: how far to push the physical body

float32.name: Proxy Body Deadzone
float32.tooltip: the physical body must move this fraction of the offset for it to make the scarab move. High values make the scarab more resistant to noise in the physics simulation, but less responsive.

float32.name: Maximum Vertical Reach
float32.tooltip: how many world-units up/down a leg can reach from the ground elevation under the scarab

float32.name: Foot Target Radius
float32.tooltip: how far around a foot to search for ground targets to stomp. Set to 0 to not search for targets

tagblock.name: Buckle Settings

float32.name: Lower Time
float32.tooltip: seconds to reach ground

float32.name: Raise Time
float32.tooltip: seconds to reach recover

float32.name: Pause Time (Easy)
float32.tooltip: seconds to wait

float32.name: Pause Time (Normal)
float32.tooltip: seconds to wait

float32.name: Pause Time (Heroic)
float32.tooltip: seconds to wait

float32.name: Pause Time (Legendary)
float32.tooltip: seconds to wait

tagblock.comment: overrides lower time and curve when not 0

float32.name: Buckle Gravity Scale
float32.tooltip: use gravity to control descent when not 0

stringid.name: Buckling Marker
stringid.tooltip: marker that shows bottom of giant and center of search area

float32.name: Forward-Rear Scan
float32.tooltip: world-unit search distance

float32.name: Left-Right Scan
float32.tooltip: world-unit search distance

ranged.name: Pitch Bounds
ranged.tooltip: giant may rotate the parent node of the buckling marker this much to align with ground.

ranged.name: Roll Bounds
ranged.tooltip: giant may rotate the parent node of the buckling marker this much to align with ground.

stringid.name: Buckle Animation
stringid.tooltip: animation to use to lower the giant

stringid.name: Descent Overlay
stringid.tooltip: animation to overlay while lowering

stringid.name: Paused Overlay
stringid.tooltip: animation to overlay while paused

float32.name: Descent Overlay Scale
float32.tooltip: max blend weight of descent overlay

float32.name: Paused Overlay Scale
float32.tooltip: max blend weight of paused overlay

float32.name: Ankle ik Scale
float32.tooltip: lower values drop the ankles towards the ground when computing ik
